href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_currencies">/wiki/Digital_currencies</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Digital currencies</a>"&gt;</span><span>digital currencies</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Password">/wiki/Password</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Password</a>"&gt;</span><span>computer passwords</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Military_communications">/wiki/Military_communications</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Military communications</a>"&gt;</span><span>military communications</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>.
<span id="line63"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Cryptography prior to the modern age was effectively synonymous with </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Encryption">/wiki/Encryption</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Encryption</a>"&gt;</span><span>encryption</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>, the conversion of information from a readable state to apparent </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nonsense">/wiki/Nonsense</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Nonsense</a>"&gt;</span><span>nonsense</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>. The originator of an encrypted message shares the decoding technique only with intended recipients to preclude access from adversaries. The cryptography literature </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alice_and_Bob">/wiki/Alice_and_Bob</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Alice and Bob</a>"&gt;</span><span>often uses the names</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> Alice ("A") for the sender, Bob ("B") for the intended recipient, and Eve ("</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eavesdropper">/wiki/Eavesdropper</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Eavesdropper</a>"&gt;</span><span>eavesdropper</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>") for the adversary.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-codesintro_5-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-codesintro-5">#cite_note-codesintro-5</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>5<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Since the development of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotor_machine">/wiki/Rotor_machine</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Rotor machine</a>"&gt;</span><span>rotor cipher machines</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> in </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_I">/wiki/World_War_I</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">World War I</a>"&gt;</span><span>World War<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#160;</span>I</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and the advent of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computer">/wiki/Computer</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Computer</a>"&gt;</span><span>computers</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> in </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II">/wiki/World_War_II</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">World War II</a>"&gt;</span><span>World War<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#160;</span>II</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, the methods used to carry out cryptology have become increasingly complex and its application more widespread.
<span id="line64"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">infeasible</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span>Modern cryptography is heavily based on mathematical theory and computer science practice; cryptographic </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algorithm">/wiki/Algorithm</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Algorithm</a>"&gt;</span><span>algorithms</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> are designed around </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computational_hardness_assumption">/wiki/Computational_hardness_assumption</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Computational hardness assumption</a>"&gt;</span><span>computational hardness assumptions</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, making such algorithms hard to break in practice by any adversary. It is theoretically possible to break such a system, but it is infeasible to do so by any known practical means. These schemes are therefore termed computationally secure; theoretical advances, e.g., improvements in </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integer_factorization">/wiki/Integer_factorization</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Integer factorization</a>"&gt;</span><span>integer factorization</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> algorithms, and faster computing technology require these solutions to be continually adapted. There exist </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information_theoretic_security">/wiki/Information_theoretic_security</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Information theoretic security</a>"&gt;</span><span>information-theoretically secure</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> schemes that provably cannot be broken even with unlimited computing power—an example is the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/One-time_pad">/wiki/One-time_pad</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">One-time pad</a>"&gt;</span><span>one-time pad</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>—but these schemes are more difficult to use in practice than the best theoretically breakable but computationally secure mechanisms.
<span id="line65"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>The growth of cryptographic technology has raised a number of legal issues in the information age. Cryptography's potential for use as a tool for </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Espionage">/wiki/Espionage</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Espionage</a>"&gt;</span><span>espionage</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sedition">/wiki/Sedition</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Sedition</a>"&gt;</span><span>sedition</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> has led many governments to classify it as a weapon and to limit or even prohibit its use and export.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-cryptolaw_6-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-cryptolaw-6">#cite_note-cryptolaw-6</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>6<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> In some jurisdictions where the use of cryptography is legal, laws permit investigators to </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Key_disclosure_law">/wiki/Key_disclosure_law</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Key disclosure law</a>"&gt;</span><span>compel the disclosure</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> of encryption keys for documents relevant to an investigation.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-UK_law_7-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-UK_law-7">#cite_note-UK_law-7</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>7<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-RangerSteve1_8-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-RangerSteve1-8">#cite_note-RangerSteve1-8</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>8<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Cryptography also plays a major role in </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_rights_management">/wiki/Digital_rights_management</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Digital rights management</a>"&gt;</span><span>digital rights management</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copyright_infringement">/wiki/Copyright_infringement</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Copyright infringement</a>"&gt;</span><span>copyright infringement</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> of digital media.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-AACS_9-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-AACS-9">#cite_note-AACS-9</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>9<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line66"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line67"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toc</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toc</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">input</span> <span class="attribute-name">type</span>="<a class="attribute-value">checkbox</a>" <span class="attribute-name">role</span>="<a class="attribute-value">button</a>" <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toctogglecheckbox</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toctogglecheckbox</a>" <span class="attribute-name">style</span>="<a class="attribute-value">display:none</a>" <span>/</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toctitle</a>" <span class="attribute-name">lang</span>="<a class="attribute-value">en</a>" <span class="attribute-name">dir</span>="<a class="attribute-value">ltr</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">h2</span>&gt;</span><span>Contents</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">h2</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toctogglespan</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">label</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toctogglelabel</a>" <span class="attribute-name">for</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toctogglecheckbox</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">label</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>

<span id="line69"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">li</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toclevel-1 tocsection-1</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#Terminology">#Terminology</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">tocnumber</a>"&gt;</span><span>1</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toctext</a>"&gt;</span><span>Terminology</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line70"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">li</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toclevel-1 tocsection-2</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#History_of_cryptography_and_cryptanalysis">#History_of_cryptography_and_cryptanalysis</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">tocnumber</a>"&gt;</span><span>2</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toctext</a>"&gt;</span><span>History of cryptography and cryptanalysis</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line71"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">ul</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line72"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">li</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toclevel-2 tocsection-3</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#Classic_cryptography">#Classic_cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">tocnumber</a>"&gt;</span><span>2.1</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toctext</a>"&gt;</span><span>Classic cryptography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line73"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">li</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toclevel-2 tocsection-4</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#Computer_era">#Computer_era</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">tocnumber</a>"&gt;</span><span>2.2</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toctext</a>"&gt;</span><span>Computer era</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line74"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">li</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toclevel-2 tocsection-5</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#Advent_of_modern_cryptography">#Advent_of_modern_cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">tocnumber</a>"&gt;</span><span>2.3</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toctext</a>"&gt;</span><span>Advent of modern cryptography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line75"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">ul</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line76"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line77"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">li</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toclevel-1 tocsection-6</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#Modern_cryptography">#Modern_cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">tocnumber</a>"&gt;</span><span>3</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">toctext</a>"&gt;</span><span>Modern cryptography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>

</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">nowrap</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>k</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> = 3</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span>. In other words, the letters in the alphabet are shifted three in one direction to encrypt and three in the other direction to decrypt.</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line104"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>The first use of the term </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>cryptograph</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> (as opposed to </span><span>&lt;<span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-10">#cite_note-10</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>10<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-11</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-11">#cite_note-11</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>11<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line105"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Until modern times, cryptography referred almost exclusively to </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>encryption</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>, which is the process of converting ordinary information (called </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plaintext">/wiki/Plaintext</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Plaintext</a>"&gt;</span><span>plaintext</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>) into unintelligible form (called </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ciphertext">/wiki/Ciphertext</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Ciphertext</a>"&gt;</span><span>ciphertext</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>).</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-kahnbook_12-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-kahnbook-12">#cite_note-kahnbook-12</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>12<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Decryption is the reverse, in other words, moving from the unintelligible ciphertext back to plaintext. A </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cipher">/wiki/Cipher</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cipher</a>"&gt;</span><span>cipher</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> (or </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>cypher</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>) is a pair of algorithms that create the encryption and the reversing decryption. The detailed operation of a cipher is controlled both by the algorithm and in each instance by a "</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Key_(cryptography)">/wiki/Key_(cryptography)</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Key (cryptography)</a>"&gt;</span><span>key</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>". The key is a secret (ideally known only to the communicants), usually a short string of characters, which is needed to decrypt the ciphertext.  Formally, a "</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptosystem">/wiki/Cryptosystem</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cryptosystem</a>"&gt;</span><span>cryptosystem</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>" is the ordered list of elements of finite possible plaintexts, finite possible cyphertexts, finite possible keys, and the encryption and decryption algorithms which correspond to each key.  Keys are important both formally and in actual practice, as ciphers without variable keys can be trivially broken with only the knowledge of the cipher used and are therefore useless (or even counter-productive) for most purposes.
<span id="line106"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Historically, ciphers were often used directly for encryption or decryption without additional procedures such as </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Authentication">/wiki/Authentication</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Authentication</a>"&gt;</span><span>authentication</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> or integrity checks. There are two kinds of cryptosystems: </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symmetric-key_algorithm">/wiki/Symmetric-key_algorithm</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Symmetric-key algorithm</a>"&gt;</span><span>symmetric</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public-key_cryptography">/wiki/Public-key_cryptography</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Public-key cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span>asymmetric</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>. In symmetric systems the same key (the secret key) is used to encrypt and decrypt a message. Data manipulation in symmetric systems is faster than asymmetric systems as they generally use shorter key lengths. Asymmetric systems use a public key to encrypt a message and a private key to decrypt it. Use of asymmetric systems enhances the security of communication.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-13</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-13">#cite_note-13</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>13<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Examples of asymmetric systems include RSA (</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rivest%E2%80%93Shamir%E2%80%93Adleman">/wiki/Rivest%E2%80%93Shamir%E2%80%93Adleman</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Rivest–Shamir–Adleman</a>"&gt;</span><span>Rivest–Shamir–Adleman</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>), and ECC (</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elliptic_Curve_Cryptography">/wiki/Elliptic_Curve_Cryptography</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Elliptic Curve Cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span>Elliptic Curve Cryptography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>). Symmetric models include the commonly used AES (</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advanced_Encryption_Standard">/wiki/Advanced_Encryption_Standard</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Advanced Encryption Standard</a>"&gt;</span><span>Advanced Encryption Standard</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>) which replaced the older DES (</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_Encryption_Standard">/wiki/Data_Encryption_Standard</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Data Encryption Standard</a>"&gt;</span><span>Data Encryption Standard</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>).</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-14</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-14">#cite_note-14</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>14<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line107"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>In </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Colloquial">/wiki/Colloquial</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Colloquial</a>"&gt;</span><span>colloquial</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> use, the term "</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Code_(cryptography)">/wiki/Code_(cryptography)</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Code (cryptography)</a>"&gt;</span><span>code</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>" is often used to mean any method of encryption or concealment of meaning. However, in cryptography, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>code</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> has a more specific meaning. It means the replacement of a unit of plaintext (i.e., a meaningful word or phrase) with a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Code_word">/wiki/Code_word</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Code word</a>"&gt;</span><span>code word</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> (for example, "wallaby" replaces "attack at dawn").
<span id="line108"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptanalysis">/wiki/Cryptanalysis</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cryptanalysis</a>"&gt;</span><span>Cryptanalysis</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> is the term used for the study of methods for obtaining the meaning of encrypted information without access to the key normally required to do so; i.e., it is the study of how to crack encryption algorithms or their implementations.
<span id="line109"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Some use the terms </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>cryptography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>cryptology</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> interchangeably in English, while others (including US military practice generally) use </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>cryptography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> to refer specifically to the use and practice of cryptographic techniques and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>cryptology</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> to refer to the combined study of cryptography and cryptanalysis.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-goldreichbook_15-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-goldreichbook-15">#cite_note-goldreichbook-15</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>15<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-websters_16-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-websters-16">#cite_note-websters-16</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>16<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> English is more flexible than several other languages in which </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>cryptology</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> (done by cryptologists) is always used in the second sense above. </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">style</span> <span class="attribute-name">data-mw-deduplicate</span>="<a class="attribute-value">TemplateStyles:r935243608</a>"&gt;</span><span>.mw-parser-output cite.citation{font-style:inherit}.mw-parser-output .citation q{quotes:"\"""\"""'""'"}.mw-parser-output .id-lock-free a,.mw-parser-output .citation .cs1-lock-free a{background:url("//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/65/Lock-green.svg/9px-Lock-green.svg.png")no-repeat;background-position:right .1em center}.mw-parser-output .id-lock-limited a,.mw-parser-output .id-lock-registration a,.mw-parser-output .citation .cs1-lock-limited a,.mw-parser-output .citation .cs1-lock-registration a{background:url("//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/Lock-gray-alt-2.svg/9px-Lock-gray-alt-2.svg.png")no-repeat;background-position:right .1em center}.mw-parser-output .id-lock-subscription a,.mw-parser-output .citation .cs1-lock-subscription a{background:url("//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/aa/Lock-red-alt-2.svg/9px-Lock-red-alt-2.svg.png")no-repeat;background-position:right .1em center}.mw-parser-output .cs1-subscription,.mw-parser-output .cs1-registration{color:#555}.mw-parser-output .cs1-subscription span,.mw-parser-output .cs1-registration span{border-bottom:1px dotted;cursor:help}.mw-parser-output .cs1-ws-icon a{background:url("//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/4/4c/Wikisource-logo.svg/12px-Wikisource-logo.svg.png")no-repeat;background-position:right .1em center}.mw-parser-output code.cs1-code{color:inherit;background:inherit;border:inherit;padding:inherit}.mw-parser-output .cs1-hidden-error{display:none;font-size:100%}.mw-parser-output .cs1-visible-error{font-size:100%}.mw-parser-output .cs1-maint{display:none;color:#33aa33;margin-left:0.3em}.mw-parser-output .cs1-subscription,.mw-parser-output .cs1-registration,.mw-parser-output .cs1-format{font-size:95%}.mw-parser-output .cs1-kern-left,.mw-parser-output .cs1-kern-wl-left{padding-left:0.2em}.mw-parser-output .cs1-kern-right,.mw-parser-output .cs1-kern-wl-right{padding-right:0.2em}</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">style</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Request_for_Comments">/wiki/Request_for_Comments</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Request for Comments</a>"&gt;</span><span>RFC</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#160;</span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">rel</span>="<a class="attribute-value">nofollow</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">external text</a>" <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2828">https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2828</a>"&gt;</span><span>2828</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> advises that </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steganography">/wiki/Steganography</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Steganography</a>"&gt;</span><span>steganography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> is sometimes included in cryptology.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-17</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-17">#cite_note-17</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>17<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line110"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>The study of characteristics of languages that have some application in cryptography or cryptology (e.g. frequency data, letter combinations, universal patterns, etc.) is called cryptolinguistics.
<span id="line111"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line112"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">h2</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-headline</a>" <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">History_of_cryptography_and_cryptanalysis</a>"&gt;</span><span>History of cryptography and cryptanalysis</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">h2</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line113"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">role</span>="<a class="attribute-value">note</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">hatnote navigation-not-searchable</a>"&gt;</span><span>Main article: </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/History_of_cryptography">/wiki/History_of_cryptography</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">History of cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span>History of cryptography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line114"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Before the modern era, cryptography focused on message confidentiality (i.e., encryption)—conversion of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Information">/wiki/Information</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Information</a>"&gt;</span><span>messages</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> from a comprehensible form into an incomprehensible one and back again at the other end, rendering it unreadable by interceptors or eavesdroppers without secret knowledge (namely the key needed for decryption of that message). Encryption attempted to ensure </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secrecy">/wiki/Secrecy</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Secrecy</a>"&gt;</span><span>secrecy</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> in </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Communications">/wiki/Communications</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Communications</a>"&gt;</span><span>communications</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, such as those of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spy">/wiki/Spy</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Spy</a>"&gt;</span><span>spies</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, military leaders, and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diplomat">/wiki/Diplomat</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Diplomat</a>"&gt;</span><span>diplomats</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>. In recent decades, the field has expanded beyond confidentiality concerns to include techniques for message integrity checking, sender/receiver identity </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Authentication">/wiki/Authentication</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Authentication</a>"&gt;</span><span>authentication</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_signature">/wiki/Digital_signature</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Digital signature</a>"&gt;</span><span>digital signatures</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interactive_proof_system">/wiki/Interactive_proof_system</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Interactive proof system</a>"&gt;</span><span>interactive proofs</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secure_multiparty_computation">/wiki/Secure_multiparty_computation</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Secure multiparty computation</a>"&gt;</span><span>secure computation</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, among others.
<span id="line115"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line116"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-headline</a>" <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Classic_cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span>Classic cryptography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line117"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumb tright</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumbinner</a>" <span class="attribute-name">style</span>="<a class="attribute-value">width:222px;</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Skytala%26EmptyStrip-Shaded.png">/wiki/File:Skytala%26EmptyStrip-Shaded.png</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">image</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">img</span> <span class="attribute-name">alt</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Skytala stick with strip of paper wound around in spiral</a>" <span class="attribute-name">src</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b2/Skytala%26EmptyStrip-Shaded.png/220px-Skytala%26EmptyStrip-Shaded.png">//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b2/Skytala%26EmptyStrip-Shaded.png/220px-Skytala%26EmptyStrip-Shaded.png</a>" <span class="attribute-name">decoding</span>="<a class="attribute-value">async</a>" <span class="attribute-name">width</span>="<a class="attribute-value">220</a>" <span class="attribute-name">height</span>="<a class="attribute-value">165</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumbimage</a>" <span class="attribute-name">srcset</span>="<a class="attribute-value">//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b2/Skytala%26EmptyStrip-Shaded.png/330px-Skytala%26EmptyStrip-Shaded.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b2/Skytala%26EmptyStrip-Shaded.png/440px-Skytala%26EmptyStrip-Shaded.png 2x</a>" <span class="attribute-name">data-file-width</span>="<a class="attribute-value">800</a>" <span class="attribute-name">data-file-height</span>="<a class="attribute-value">600</a>" <span>/</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>  </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumbcaption</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">magnify</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Skytala%26EmptyStrip-Shaded.png">/wiki/File:Skytala%26EmptyStrip-Shaded.png</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">internal</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Enlarge</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>Reconstructed </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_Greek">/wiki/Ancient_Greek</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Ancient Greek</a>"&gt;</span><span>ancient Greek</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scytale">/wiki/Scytale</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Scytale</a>"&gt;</span><span>scytale</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>, an early cipher device</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line118"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>The main classical cipher types are </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transposition_cipher">/wiki/Transposition_cipher</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Transposition cipher</a>"&gt;</span><span>transposition ciphers</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, which rearrange the order of letters in a message (e.g., 'hello world' becomes 'ehlol owrdl' in a trivially simple rearrangement scheme), and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Substitution_cipher">/wiki/Substitution_cipher</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Substitution cipher</a>"&gt;</span><span>substitution ciphers</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, which systematically replace letters or groups of letters with other letters or groups of letters (e.g., 'fly at once' becomes 'gmz bu podf' by replacing each letter with the one following it in the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latin_alphabet">/wiki/Latin_alphabet</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Latin alphabet</a>"&gt;</span><span>Latin alphabet</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>). Simple versions of either have never offered much confidentiality from enterprising opponents. An early substitution cipher was the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Caesar_cipher">/wiki/Caesar_cipher</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Caesar cipher</a>"&gt;</span><span>Caesar cipher</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, in which each letter in the plaintext was replaced by a letter some fixed number of positions further down the alphabet. </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suetonius">/wiki/Suetonius</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Suetonius</a>"&gt;</span><span>Suetonius</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> reports that </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Julius_Caesar">/wiki/Julius_Caesar</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Julius Caesar</a>"&gt;</span><span>Julius Caesar</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> used it with a shift of three to communicate with his generals. </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atbash">/wiki/Atbash</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Atbash</a>"&gt;</span><span>Atbash</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> is an example of an early Hebrew cipher. The earliest known use of cryptography is some carved ciphertext on stone in </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Egypt">/wiki/Egypt</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Egypt</a>"&gt;</span><span>Egypt</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> (ca 1900 BCE), but this may have been done for the amusement of literate observers rather than as a way of concealing information.
<span id="line119"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>The </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ancient_Greece">/wiki/Ancient_Greece</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Ancient Greece</a>"&gt;</span><span>Greeks of Classical times</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> are said to have known of ciphers (e.g., the scytale transposition cipher claimed to have been used by the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sparta">/wiki/Sparta</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Sparta</a>"&gt;</span><span>Spartan</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> military).</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-18</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-18">#cite_note-18</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>18<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steganography">/wiki/Steganography</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Steganography</a>"&gt;</span><span>Steganography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> (i.e., hiding even the existence of a message so as to keep it confidential) was also first developed in ancient times. An early example, from </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Herodotus">/wiki/Herodotus</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Herodotus</a>"&gt;</span><span>Herodotus</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, was a message tattooed on a slave's shaved head and concealed under the regrown hair.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-kahnbook_12-1</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-kahnbook-12">#cite_note-kahnbook-12</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>12<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> More modern examples of steganography include the use of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Invisible_ink">/wiki/Invisible_ink</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Invisible ink</a>"&gt;</span><span>invisible ink</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microdot">/wiki/Microdot</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Microdot</a>"&gt;</span><span>microdots</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_watermark">/wiki/Digital_watermark</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Digital watermark</a>"&gt;</span><span>digital watermarks</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> to conceal information.
<span id="line120"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>In India, the 2000-year-old </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamasutra">/wiki/Kamasutra</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Kamasutra</a>"&gt;</span><span>Kamasutra</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/V%C4%81tsy%C4%81yana">/wiki/V%C4%81tsy%C4%81yana</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Vātsyāyana</a>"&gt;</span><span>Vātsyāyana</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> speaks of two different kinds of ciphers called Kautiliyam and Mulavediya. In the Kautiliyam, the cipher letter substitutions are based on phonetic relations, such as vowels becoming consonants. In the Mulavediya, the cipher alphabet consists of pairing letters and using the reciprocal ones.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-kahnbook_12-2</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-kahnbook-12">#cite_note-kahnbook-12</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>12<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line121"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>In </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sassanid_Persia">/wiki/Sassanid_Persia</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Sassanid Persia</a>"&gt;</span><span>Sassanid Persia</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, there were two secret scripts, according to the Muslim author </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ibn_al-Nadim">/wiki/Ibn_al-Nadim</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Ibn al-Nadim</a>"&gt;</span><span>Ibn al-Nadim</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>: the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>šāh-dabīrīya</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> (literally "King's script") which was used for official correspondence, and the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>rāz-saharīya</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> which was used to communicate secret messages with other countries.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-19</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-19">#cite_note-19</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>19<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line122"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Kahn_(writer)">/wiki/David_Kahn_(writer)</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">David Kahn (writer)</a>"&gt;</span><span>David Kahn</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> notes in </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Codebreakers">/wiki/The_Codebreakers</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">The Codebreakers</a>"&gt;</span><span>The Codebreakers</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> that modern cryptology originated among the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arabs">/wiki/Arabs</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Arabs</a>"&gt;</span><span>Arabs</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, the first people to systematically document cryptanalytic methods.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-20</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-20">#cite_note-20</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>20<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Khalil_ibn_Ahmad_al-Farahidi">/wiki/Al-Khalil_ibn_Ahmad_al-Farahidi</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Al-Khalil ibn Ahmad al-Farahidi</a>"&gt;</span><span>Al-Khalil</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> (717–786) wrote the </span><span>&lt;<span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Kindi">/wiki/Al-Kindi</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a <span id="line125"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Ciphertexts produced by a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Classical_cipher">/wiki/Classical_cipher</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Classical cipher</a>"&gt;</span><span>classical cipher</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> (and some modern ciphers) will reveal statistical information about the plaintext, and that information can often be used to break the cipher. After the discovery of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Al-Kindi">/wiki/Al-Kindi</a>" <span could be broken by an informed attacker. Such classical ciphers still enjoy popularity today, though mostly as </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Puzzle">/wiki/Puzzle</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Puzzle</a>"&gt;</span><span>puzzles</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>.
