href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:TLS_indicator_in_Firefox_34.png">/wiki/File:TLS_indicator_in_Firefox_34.png</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">internal</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Enlarge</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>Padlock icon from the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firefox">/wiki/Firefox</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Firefox</a>"&gt;</span><span>Firefox</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_browser">/wiki/Web_browser</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Web browser</a>"&gt;</span><span>Web browser</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, which indicates that </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transport_Layer_Security">/wiki/Transport_Layer_Security</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Transport Layer Security</a>"&gt;</span><span>TLS</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, a public-key cryptography system, is in use.</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line160"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Symmetric-key cryptosystems use the same key for encryption and decryption of a message, although a message or group of messages can have a different key than others. A significant disadvantage of symmetric ciphers is the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Key_management">/wiki/Key_management</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Key management</a>"&gt;</span><span>key management</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> necessary to use them securely. Each distinct pair of communicating parties must, ideally, share a different key, and perhaps for each ciphertext exchanged as well. The number of keys required increases as the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Square_(algebra)">/wiki/Square_(algebra)</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Square (algebra)</a>"&gt;</span><span>square</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> of the number of network members, which very quickly requires complex key management schemes to keep them all consistent and secret.
<span id="line161"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line162"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">style</span> <span class="attribute-name">data-mw-deduplicate</span>="<a href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Martin_Hellman">/wiki/Martin_Hellman</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Martin Hellman</a>"&gt;</span><span>Martin Hellman</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, authors of the first published paper on public-key cryptography.</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line163"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>In a groundbreaking 1976 paper, Whitfield Diffie and Martin Hellman proposed the notion of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>public-key</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> (also, more generally, called </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>asymmetric key</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>) cryptography in which two different but mathematically related keys are used—a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>public</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> key and a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>private</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> key.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-42</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-42">#cite_note-42</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>42<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> A public key system is so constructed that calculation of one key (the 'private key') is computationally infeasible from the other (the 'public key'), even though they are necessarily related. Instead, both keys are generated secretly, as an interrelated pair.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-43</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-43">#cite_note-43</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>43<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> The historian </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Kahn_(writer)">/wiki/David_Kahn_(writer)</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">David Kahn (writer)</a>"&gt;</span><span>David Kahn</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> described public-key cryptography as "the most revolutionary new concept in the field since polyalphabetic substitution emerged in the Renaissance".</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-44</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-44">#cite_note-44</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>44<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line164"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>In public-key cryptosystems, the public key may be freely distributed, while its paired private key must remain secret. In a public-key encryption system, the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>public key</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> is used for encryption, while the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>private</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> or </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>secret key</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> is used for decryption. While Diffie and Hellman could not find such a system, they showed that public-key cryptography was indeed possible by presenting the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Diffie%E2%80%93Hellman_key_exchange">/wiki/Diffie%E2%80%93Hellman_key_exchange</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Diffie–Hellman key exchange</a>"&gt;</span><span>Diffie–Hellman key exchange</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> protocol, a solution that is now widely used in secure communications to allow two parties to secretly agree on a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symmetric-key_algorithm">/wiki/Symmetric-key_algorithm</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Symmetric-key algorithm</a>"&gt;</span><span>shared encryption key</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-dh2_31-2</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-dh2-31">#cite_note-dh2-31</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>31<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> 
<span id="line165"></span>The </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/X.509">/wiki/X.509</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">X.509</a>"&gt;</span><span>X.509</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> standard defines the most commonly used format for </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public_key_certificates">/wiki/Public_key_certificates</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Public key certificates</a>"&gt;</span><span>public key certificates</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-45</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-45">#cite_note-45</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>45<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line166"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Diffie and Hellman's publication sparked widespread academic efforts in finding a practical public-key encryption system. This race was finally won in 1978 by </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ronald_Rivest">/wiki/Ronald_Rivest</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Ronald Rivest</a>"&gt;</span><span>Ronald Rivest</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adi_Shamir">/wiki/Adi_Shamir</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Adi Shamir</a>"&gt;</span><span>Adi Shamir</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Len_Adleman">/wiki/Len_Adleman</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Len Adleman</a>"&gt;</span><span>Len Adleman</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, whose solution has since become known as the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_(algorithm)">/wiki/RSA_(algorithm)</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">RSA (algorithm)</a>"&gt;</span><span>RSA algorithm</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-46</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-46">#cite_note-46</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>46<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line167"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>The Diffie–Hellman and RSA algorithms, in addition to being the first publicly known examples of high quality public-key algorithms, have been among the most widely used. Other </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:Asymmetric-key_algorithms">/wiki/Category:Asymmetric-key_algorithms</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Category:Asymmetric-key algorithms</a>"&gt;</span><span>asymmetric-key algorithms</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> include the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cramer%E2%80%93Shoup_cryptosystem">/wiki/Cramer%E2%80%93Shoup_cryptosystem</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cramer–Shoup cryptosystem</a>"&gt;</span><span>Cramer–Shoup cryptosystem</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ElGamal_encryption">/wiki/ElGamal_encryption</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">ElGamal encryption</a>"&gt;</span><span>ElGamal encryption</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, and various </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elliptic_curve_cryptography">/wiki/Elliptic_curve_cryptography</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Elliptic curve cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span>elliptic curve techniques</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact</a>" <span class="attribute-name">style</span>="<a class="attribute-value">white-space:nowrap;</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed">/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Wikipedia:Citation needed</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">This claim needs references to reliable sources. (August 2018)</a>"&gt;</span><span>citation needed</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line168"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>A document published in 1997 by the Government Communications Headquarters (</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GCHQ">/wiki/GCHQ</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">GCHQ</a>"&gt;</span><span>GCHQ</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>), a British intelligence organization, revealed that cryptographers at GCHQ had anticipated several academic developments.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-nytimes_47-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-nytimes-47">#cite_note-nytimes-47</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>47<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Reportedly, around 1970, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_H._Ellis">/wiki/James_H._Ellis</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">James H. Ellis</a>"&gt;</span><span>James H. Ellis</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> had conceived the principles of asymmetric key cryptography. In 1973, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clifford_Cocks">/wiki/Clifford_Cocks</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Clifford Cocks</a>"&gt;</span><span>Clifford Cocks</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> invented a solution that very similar in design rationale to RSA.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-nytimes_47-1</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-nytimes-47">#cite_note-nytimes-47</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>47<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-48</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-48">#cite_note-48</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>48<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> And in 1974, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Malcolm_J._Williamson">/wiki/Malcolm_J._Williamson</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Malcolm J. Williamson</a>"&gt;</span><span>Malcolm J. Williamson</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> is claimed to have developed the Diffie–Hellman key exchange.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-singh_49-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-singh-49">#cite_note-singh-49</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>49<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line169"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line170"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumb tright</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumbinner</a>" <span class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Private_key_signing.svg">/wiki/File:Private_key_signing.svg</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a <span class="attribute-name">decoding</span>="<a class="attribute-value">async</a>" <span class="attribute-name">width</span>="<a class="attribute-value">250</a>" <span
