class="attribute-value">magnify</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Private_key_signing.svg">/wiki/File:Private_key_signing.svg</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">internal</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Enlarge</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>In this example the message is only signed and not encrypted. 1) Alice signs a message with her private key. 2) Bob can verify that Alice sent the message and that the message has not been modified.</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line171"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Public-key cryptography is also used for implementing </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_signature">/wiki/Digital_signature</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Digital signature</a>"&gt;</span><span>digital signature</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> schemes. A digital signature is reminiscent of an ordinary </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Signature">/wiki/Signature</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Signature</a>"&gt;</span><span>signature</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>; they both have the characteristic of being easy for a user to produce, but difficult for anyone else to </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forgery">/wiki/Forgery</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Forgery</a>"&gt;</span><span>forge</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>. Digital signatures can also be permanently tied to the content of the message being signed; they cannot then be 'moved' from one document to another, for any attempt will be detectable. In digital signature schemes, there are two algorithms: one for </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>signing</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>, in which a secret key is used to process the message (or a hash of the message, or both), and one for </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>verification</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>, in which the matching public key is used with the message to check the validity of the signature. RSA and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_Signature_Algorithm">/wiki/Digital_Signature_Algorithm</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Digital Signature Algorithm</a>"&gt;</span><span>DSA</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> are two of the most popular digital signature schemes. Digital signatures are central to the operation of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public_key_infrastructure">/wiki/Public_key_infrastructure</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Public key infrastructure</a>"&gt;</span><span>public key infrastructures</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and many network security schemes (e.g., </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transport_Layer_Security">/wiki/Transport_Layer_Security</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Transport Layer Security</a>"&gt;</span><span>SSL/TLS</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, many </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VPN">/wiki/VPN</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">VPN</a>"&gt;</span><span>VPNs</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, etc.).</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-schneierbook_39-1</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-schneierbook-39">#cite_note-schneierbook-39</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>39<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line172"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Public-key algorithms are most often based on the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computational_complexity_theory">/wiki/Computational_complexity_theory</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Computational complexity theory</a>"&gt;</span><span>computational complexity</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> of "hard" problems, often from </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Number_theory">/wiki/Number_theory</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Number theory</a>"&gt;</span><span>number theory</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>. For example, the hardness of RSA is related to the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integer_factorization">/wiki/Integer_factorization</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Integer factorization</a>"&gt;</span><span>integer factorization</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> problem, while Diffie–Hellman and DSA are related to the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discrete_logarithm">/wiki/Discrete_logarithm</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Discrete logarithm</a>"&gt;</span><span>discrete logarithm</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> problem. The security of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elliptic_curve_cryptography">/wiki/Elliptic_curve_cryptography</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Elliptic curve cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span>elliptic curve cryptography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> is based on number theoretic problems involving </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elliptic_curve">/wiki/Elliptic_curve</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Elliptic curve</a>"&gt;</span><span>elliptic curves</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>. Because of the difficulty of the underlying problems, most public-key algorithms involve operations such as </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Modular_arithmetic">/wiki/Modular_arithmetic</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Modular arithmetic</a>"&gt;</span><span>modular</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> multiplication and exponentiation, which are much more computationally expensive than the techniques used in most block ciphers, especially with typical key sizes. As a result, public-key cryptosystems are commonly </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hybrid_cryptosystem">/wiki/Hybrid_cryptosystem</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Hybrid cryptosystem</a>"&gt;</span><span>hybrid cryptosystems</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, in which a fast high-quality symmetric-key encryption algorithm is used for the message itself, while the relevant symmetric key is sent with the message, but encrypted using a public-key algorithm. Similarly, hybrid signature schemes are often used, in which a cryptographic hash function is computed, and only the resulting hash is digitally signed.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-hac_4-5</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-hac-4">#cite_note-hac-4</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>4<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line173"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line174"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-headline</a>" <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cryptanalysis</a>"&gt;</span><span>Cryptanalysis</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line175"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">role</span>="<a class="attribute-value">note</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">hatnote navigation-not-searchable</a>"&gt;</span><span>Main article: </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptanalysis">/wiki/Cryptanalysis</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cryptanalysis</a>"&gt;</span><span>Cryptanalysis</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line176"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumb tleft</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumbinner</a>" <span class="attribute-name">style</span>="<a class="attribute-value">width:222px;</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Enigma.jpg">/wiki/File:Enigma.jpg</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">image</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">img</span> <span class="attribute-name">alt</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Enigma machine typewriter keypad over many rotors in a wood box</a>" <span class="attribute-name">src</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Enigma.jpg/220px-Enigma.jpg">//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Enigma.jpg/220px-Enigma.jpg</a>" <span class="attribute-name">decoding</span>="<a class="attribute-value">async</a>" <span class="attribute-name">width</span>="<a class="attribute-value">220</a>" <span class="attribute-name">height</span>="<a class="attribute-value">293</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumbimage</a>" <span class="attribute-name">srcset</span>="<a class="attribute-value">//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Enigma.jpg/330px-Enigma.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ae/Enigma.jpg/440px-Enigma.jpg 2x</a>" <span class="attribute-name">data-file-width</span>="<a class="attribute-value">450</a>" <span class="attribute-name">data-file-height</span>="<a class="attribute-value">600</a>" <span>/</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>  </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumbcaption</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">magnify</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Enigma.jpg">/wiki/File:Enigma.jpg</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">internal</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Enlarge</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>Variants of the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Enigma_machine">/wiki/Enigma_machine</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Enigma machine</a>"&gt;</span><span>Enigma machine</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, used by Germany's military and civil authorities from the late 1920s through </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II">/wiki/World_War_II</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">World War II</a>"&gt;</span><span>World War II</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, implemented a complex electro-mechanical polyalphabetic </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cipher">/wiki/Cipher</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cipher</a>"&gt;</span><span>cipher</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>. </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptanalysis_of_the_Enigma">/wiki/Cryptanalysis_of_the_Enigma</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cryptanalysis of the Enigma</a>"&gt;</span><span>Breaking and reading of the Enigma cipher</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> at Poland's </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Biuro_Szyfr%C3%B3w">/wiki/Biuro_Szyfr%C3%B3w</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Biuro Szyfrów</a>"&gt;</span><span>Cipher Bureau</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, for 7 years before the war, and subsequent decryption at </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bletchley_Park">/wiki/Bletchley_Park</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Bletchley Park</a>"&gt;</span><span>Bletchley Park</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, was important to Allied victory.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-kahnbook_12-3</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-kahnbook-12">#cite_note-kahnbook-12</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>12<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line177"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>The goal of cryptanalysis is to find some weakness or insecurity in a cryptographic scheme, thus permitting its subversion or evasion.
<span id="line178"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>It is a common misconception that every encryption method can be broken. In connection with his WWII work at </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bell_Labs">/wiki/Bell_Labs</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Bell Labs</a>"&gt;</span><span>Bell Labs</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Claude_Shannon">/wiki/Claude_Shannon</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Claude Shannon</a>"&gt;</span><span>Claude Shannon</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> proved that the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/One-time_pad">/wiki/One-time_pad</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">One-time pad</a>"&gt;</span><span>one-time pad</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> cipher is unbreakable, provided the key material is truly </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Statistical_randomness">/wiki/Statistical_randomness</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Statistical randomness</a>"&gt;</span><span>random</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, never reused, kept secret from all possible attackers, and of equal or greater length than the message.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-50</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-50">#cite_note-50</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>50<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Most </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cipher">/wiki/Cipher</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cipher</a>"&gt;</span><span>ciphers</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, apart from the one-time pad, can be broken with enough computational effort by </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Brute_force_attack">/wiki/Brute_force_attack</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Brute force attack</a>"&gt;</span><span>brute force attack</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, but the amount of effort needed may be </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exponential_time">/wiki/Exponential_time</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Exponential time</a>"&gt;</span><span>exponentially</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> dependent on the key size, as compared to the effort needed to make use of the cipher. In such cases, effective security could be achieved if it is proven that the effort required (i.e., "work factor", in Shannon's terms) is beyond the ability of any adversary. This means it must be shown that no efficient method (as opposed to the time-consuming brute force method) can be found to break the cipher. Since no such proof has been found to date, the one-time-pad remains the only theoretically unbreakable cipher.
<span id="line179"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>There are a wide variety of cryptanalytic attacks, and they can be classified in any of several ways. A common distinction turns on what Eve (an attacker) knows and what capabilities are available. In a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ciphertext-only_attack">/wiki/Ciphertext-only_attack</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Ciphertext-only attack</a>"&gt;</span><span>ciphertext-only attack</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, Eve has access only to the ciphertext (good modern cryptosystems are usually effectively immune to ciphertext-only attacks). In a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Known-plaintext_attack">/wiki/Known-plaintext_attack</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Known-plaintext attack</a>"&gt;</span><span>known-plaintext attack</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, Eve has access to a ciphertext and its corresponding plaintext (or to many such pairs). In a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chosen-plaintext_attack">/wiki/Chosen-plaintext_attack</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Chosen-plaintext attack</a>"&gt;</span><span>chosen-plaintext attack</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, Eve may choose a plaintext and learn its corresponding ciphertext (perhaps many times); an example is </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gardening_(cryptanalysis)">/wiki/Gardening_(cryptanalysis)</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Gardening (cryptanalysis)</a>"&gt;</span><span>gardening</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, used by the British during WWII. In a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chosen-ciphertext_attack">/wiki/Chosen-ciphertext_attack</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Chosen-ciphertext attack</a>"&gt;</span><span>chosen-ciphertext attack</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, Eve may be able to </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>choose</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> ciphertexts and learn their corresponding plaintexts.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-hac_4-6</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-hac-4">#cite_note-hac-4</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>4<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Finally in a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Man-in-the-middle_attack">/wiki/Man-in-the-middle_attack</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Man-in-the-middle attack</a>"&gt;</span><span>man-in-the-middle</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> attack Eve gets in between Alice (the sender) and Bob (the recipient), accesses and modifies the traffic and then forwards it to the recipient.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-51</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-51">#cite_note-51</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>51<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Also important, often overwhelmingly so, are mistakes (generally in the design or use of one of the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptographic_protocol">/wiki/Cryptographic_protocol</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cryptographic protocol</a>"&gt;</span><span>protocols</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> involved.
<span id="line180"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line181"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumb tright</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumbinner</a>" <span class="attribute-name">style</span>="<a class="attribute-value">width:222px;</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2008-09_Kaiserschloss_Kryptologen.JPG">/wiki/File:2008-09_Kaiserschloss_Kryptologen.JPG</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">image</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">img</span> <span class="attribute-name">alt</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Kaiserschloss Kryptologen monument numbers on stele</a>" <span class="attribute-name">src</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ad/2008-09_Kaiserschloss_Kryptologen.JPG/220px-2008-09_Kaiserschloss_Kryptologen.JPG">//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ad/2008-09_Kaiserschloss_Kryptologen.JPG/220px-2008-09_Kaiserschloss_Kryptologen.JPG</a>" <span class="attribute-name">decoding</span>="<a class="attribute-value">async</a>" <span class="attribute-name">width</span>="<a class="attribute-value">220</a>" <span class="attribute-name">height</span>="<a class="attribute-value">157</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumbimage</a>" <span class="attribute-name">srcset</span>="<a class="attribute-value">//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ad/2008-09_Kaiserschloss_Kryptologen.JPG/330px-2008-09_Kaiserschloss_Kryptologen.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/ad/2008-09_Kaiserschloss_Kryptologen.JPG/440px-2008-09_Kaiserschloss_Kryptologen.JPG 2x</a>" <span class="attribute-name">data-file-width</span>="<a class="attribute-value">2770</a>" <span class="attribute-name">data-file-height</span>="<a class="attribute-value">1981</a>" <span>/</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>  </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumbcaption</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">magnify</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:2008-09_Kaiserschloss_Kryptologen.JPG">/wiki/File:2008-09_Kaiserschloss_Kryptologen.JPG</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">internal</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Enlarge</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pozna%C5%84">/wiki/Pozna%C5%84</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Poznań</a>"&gt;</span><span>Poznań</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> monument (</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>center</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>) to Polish cryptanalysts whose breaking of Germany's Enigma machine ciphers, beginning in 1932, altered the course of World War II</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line182"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Cryptanalysis of symmetric-key ciphers typically involves looking for attacks against the block ciphers or stream ciphers that are more efficient than any attack that could be against a perfect cipher. For example, a simple brute force attack against DES requires one known plaintext and 2</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>55</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> decryptions, trying approximately half of the possible keys, to reach a point at which chances are better than even that the key sought will have been found. But this may not be enough assurance; a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linear_cryptanalysis">/wiki/Linear_cryptanalysis</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Linear cryptanalysis</a>"&gt;</span><span>linear cryptanalysis</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> attack against DES requires 2</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>43</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> known plaintexts (with their corresponding ciphertexts) and approximately 2</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>43</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> DES operations.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-junod_52-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-junod-52">#cite_note-junod-52</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>52<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> This is a considerable improvement over brute force attacks.
<span id="line183"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Public-key algorithms are based on the computational difficulty of various problems. The most famous of these are the difficulty of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Integer_factorization">/wiki/Integer_factorization</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Integer factorization</a>"&gt;</span><span>integer factorization</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Semiprime">/wiki/Semiprime</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Semiprime</a>"&gt;</span><span>semiprimes</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and the difficulty of calculating </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discrete_logarithm">/wiki/Discrete_logarithm</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Discrete logarithm</a>"&gt;</span><span>discrete logarithms</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, both of which are not yet proven to be solvable in </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/P_(complexity)">/wiki/P_(complexity)</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">P (complexity)</a>"&gt;</span><span>polynomial time</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> using only a classical </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turing_completeness">/wiki/Turing_completeness</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Turing completeness</a>"&gt;</span><span>Turing-complete</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> computer. Much public-key cryptanalysis concerns designing algorithms in P that can solve these problems, or using other technologies, such as </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quantum_computing">/wiki/Quantum_computing</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Quantum computing</a>"&gt;</span><span>quantum computers</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>. For instance, the best known algorithms for solving the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elliptic_curve_cryptography">/wiki/Elliptic_curve_cryptography</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Elliptic curve cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span>elliptic curve-based</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> version of discrete logarithm are much more time-consuming than the best known algorithms for factoring, at least for problems of more or less equivalent size. Thus, other things being equal, to achieve an equivalent strength of attack resistance, factoring-based encryption techniques must use larger keys than elliptic curve techniques. For this reason, public-key cryptosystems based on elliptic curves have become popular since their invention in the mid-1990s.
<span id="line184"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>While pure cryptanalysis uses weaknesses in the algorithms themselves, other attacks on cryptosystems are based on actual use of the algorithms in real devices, and are called </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Side-channel_attack">/wiki/Side-channel_attack</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Side-channel attack</a>"&gt;</span><span>side-channel attacks</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>. If a cryptanalyst has access to, for example, the amount of time the device took to encrypt a number of plaintexts or report an error in a password or PIN character, he may be able to use a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timing_attack">/wiki/Timing_attack</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Timing attack</a>"&gt;</span><span>timing attack</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> to break a cipher that is otherwise resistant to analysis. An attacker might also study the pattern and length of messages to derive valuable information; this is known as </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Traffic_analysis">/wiki/Traffic_analysis</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Traffic analysis</a>"&gt;</span><span>traffic analysis</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-SWT_53-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-SWT-53">#cite_note-SWT-53</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>53<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> and can be quite useful to an alert adversary. Poor administration of a cryptosystem, such as permitting too short keys, will make any system vulnerable, regardless of other virtues. </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Social_engineering_(security)">/wiki/Social_engineering_(security)</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Social engineering (security)</a>"&gt;</span><span>Social engineering</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and other attacks against humans (e.g., </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bribery">/wiki/Bribery</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Bribery</a>"&gt;</span><span>bribery</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Extortion">/wiki/Extortion</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Extortion</a>"&gt;</span><span>extortion</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blackmail">/wiki/Blackmail</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Blackmail</a>"&gt;</span><span>blackmail</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Espionage">/wiki/Espionage</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Espionage</a>"&gt;</span><span>espionage</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Torture">/wiki/Torture</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Torture</a>"&gt;</span><span>torture</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, ...) are usually employed due to being more cost-effective and feasible to perform in a reasonable amount of time compared to pure cryptanalysis by a high margin.
<span id="line185"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line186"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-headline</a>" <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cryptographic_primitives</a>"&gt;</span><span>Cryptographic primitives</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line187"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Much of the theoretical work in cryptography concerns </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptographic_primitive">/wiki/Cryptographic_primitive</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cryptographic primitive</a>"&gt;</span><span>cryptographic </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>primitives</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>—algorithms with basic cryptographic properties—and their relationship to other cryptographic problems. More complicated cryptographic tools are then built from these basic primitives. These primitives provide fundamental properties, which are used to develop more complex tools called </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>cryptosystems</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> or </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>cryptographic protocols</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>, which guarantee one or more high-level security properties. Note however, that the distinction between cryptographic </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>primitives</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span> and cryptosystems, is quite arbitrary; for example, the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_(algorithm)">/wiki/RSA_(algorithm)</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">RSA (algorithm)</a>"&gt;</span><span>RSA</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> algorithm is sometimes considered a cryptosystem, and sometimes a primitive. Typical examples of cryptographic primitives include </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pseudorandom_function">/wiki/Pseudorandom_function</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Pseudorandom function</a>"&gt;</span><span>pseudorandom functions</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/One-way_function">/wiki/One-way_function</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">One-way function</a>"&gt;</span><span>one-way functions</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, etc.
<span id="line188"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line189"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-headline</a>" <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cryptosystems</a>"&gt;</span><span>Cryptosystems</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line190"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>One or more cryptographic primitives are often used to develop a more complex algorithm, called a cryptographic system, or </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>cryptosystem</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>. Cryptosystems (e.g., </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ElGamal_encryption">/wiki/ElGamal_encryption</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">ElGamal encryption</a>"&gt;</span><span>El-Gamal encryption</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>) are designed to provide particular functionality (e.g., public key encryption) while guaranteeing certain security properties (e.g., </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chosen-plaintext_attack">/wiki/Chosen-plaintext_attack</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Chosen-plaintext attack</a>"&gt;</span><span>chosen-plaintext attack (CPA)</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> security in the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Random_oracle_model">/wiki/Random_oracle_model</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Random oracle model</a>"&gt;</span><span>random oracle model</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>). Cryptosystems use the properties of the underlying cryptographic primitives to support the system's security properties. As the distinction between primitives and cryptosystems is somewhat arbitrary, a sophisticated cryptosystem can be derived from a combination of several more primitive cryptosystems. In many cases, the cryptosystem's structure involves back and forth communication among two or more parties in space (e.g., between the sender of a secure message and its receiver) or across time (e.g., cryptographically protected </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Backup">/wiki/Backup</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Backup</a>"&gt;</span><span>backup</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> data). Such cryptosystems are sometimes called </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptographic_protocol">/wiki/Cryptographic_protocol</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cryptographic protocol</a>"&gt;</span><span>cryptographic protocols</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span>.
<span id="line191"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Some widely known cryptosystems include </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_(algorithm)">/wiki/RSA_(algorithm)</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">RSA (algorithm)</a>"&gt;</span><span>RSA encryption</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schnorr_signature">/wiki/Schnorr_signature</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Schnorr signature</a>"&gt;</span><span>Schnorr signature</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ElGamal_encryption">/wiki/ElGamal_encryption</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">ElGamal encryption</a>"&gt;</span><span>El-Gamal encryption</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pretty_Good_Privacy">/wiki/Pretty_Good_Privacy</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Pretty Good Privacy</a>"&gt;</span><span>PGP</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, etc. More complex cryptosystems include </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electronic_cash">/wiki/Electronic_cash</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Electronic cash</a>"&gt;</span><span>electronic cash</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-54</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-54">#cite_note-54</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>54<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> systems, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Signcryption">/wiki/Signcryption</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Signcryption</a>"&gt;</span><span>signcryption</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> systems, etc. Some more 'theoretical'</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">noprint Inline-Template</a>" <span class="attribute-name">style</span>="<a class="attribute-value">margin-left:0.1em; white-space:nowrap;</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Please_clarify">/wiki/Wikipedia:Please_clarify</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Wikipedia:Please clarify</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">What<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#39;</span>s <span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>quot;</span>theoretical<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>quot;</span> about it? They are implementable and proven to work, unlike theories which are partially proven conjecture. (December 2018)</a>"&gt;</span><span>clarification needed</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> cryptosystems include </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Interactive_proof_system">/wiki/Interactive_proof_system</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Interactive proof system</a>"&gt;</span><span>interactive proof systems</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>,</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-55</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zero-knowledge_proof">/wiki/Zero-knowledge_proof</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Zero-knowledge
