</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Secret_sharing">/wiki/Secret_sharing</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Secret sharing</a>"&gt;</span><span>secret sharing</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>,</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-57</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-57">#cite_note-57</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>57<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-58</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-58">#cite_note-58</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>58<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> etc.
<span id="line192"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line193"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">h2</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-headline</a>" <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Legal_issues</a>"&gt;</span><span>Legal issues</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">h2</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line194"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">role</span>="<a class="attribute-value">note</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">hatnote navigation-not-searchable</a>"&gt;</span><span>See also: </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography_laws_in_different_nations">/wiki/Cryptography_laws_in_different_nations</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cryptography laws in different nations</a>"&gt;</span><span>Cryptography laws in different nations</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line195"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-headline</a>" <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Prohibitions</a>"&gt;</span><span>Prohibitions</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line196"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Cryptography has long been of interest to intelligence gathering and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Law_enforcement_agency">/wiki/Law_enforcement_agency</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Law enforcement agency</a>"&gt;</span><span>law enforcement agencies</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-RangerSteve1_8-1</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-RangerSteve1-8">#cite_note-RangerSteve1-8</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>8<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Secret communications may be criminal or even </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Treason">/wiki/Treason</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Treason</a>"&gt;</span><span>treasonous</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact</a>" <span class="attribute-name">style</span>="<a class="attribute-value">white-space:nowrap;</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed">/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Wikipedia:Citation needed</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">This claim needs references to reliable sources. (April 2016)</a>"&gt;</span><span>citation needed</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>. Because of its facilitation of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Privacy">/wiki/Privacy</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Privacy</a>"&gt;</span><span>privacy</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, and the diminution of privacy attendant on its prohibition, cryptography is also of considerable interest to civil rights supporters. Accordingly, there has been a history of controversial legal issues surrounding cryptography, especially since the advent of inexpensive computers has made widespread access to high quality cryptography possible.
<span id="line197"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>In some countries, even the domestic use of cryptography is, or has been, restricted. Until 1999, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/France">/wiki/France</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">France</a>"&gt;</span><span>France</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> significantly restricted the use of cryptography domestically, though it has since relaxed many of these rules. In </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/People%27s_Republic_of_China">/wiki/People%27s_Republic_of_China</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">People<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#39;</span>s Republic of China</a>"&gt;</span><span>China</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Islamic_Republic_of_Iran">/wiki/Islamic_Republic_of_Iran</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Islamic Republic of Iran</a>"&gt;</span><span>Iran</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, a license is still required to use cryptography.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-cryptolaw_6-1</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-cryptolaw-6">#cite_note-cryptolaw-6</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>6<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Many countries have tight restrictions on the use of cryptography. Among the more restrictive are laws in </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Belarus">/wiki/Belarus</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Belarus</a>"&gt;</span><span>Belarus</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kazakhstan">/wiki/Kazakhstan</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Kazakhstan</a>"&gt;</span><span>Kazakhstan</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mongolia">/wiki/Mongolia</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Mongolia</a>"&gt;</span><span>Mongolia</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pakistan">/wiki/Pakistan</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Pakistan</a>"&gt;</span><span>Pakistan</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Singapore">/wiki/Singapore</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Singapore</a>"&gt;</span><span>Singapore</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tunisia">/wiki/Tunisia</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Tunisia</a>"&gt;</span><span>Tunisia</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vietnam">/wiki/Vietnam</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Vietnam</a>"&gt;</span><span>Vietnam</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-59</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-59">#cite_note-59</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>59<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line198"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>In the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States">/wiki/United_States</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">United States</a>"&gt;</span><span>United States</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, cryptography is legal for domestic use, but there has been much conflict over legal issues related to cryptography.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-RangerSteve1_8-2</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-RangerSteve1-8">#cite_note-RangerSteve1-8</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>8<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> One particularly important issue has been the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Export_of_cryptography">/wiki/Export_of_cryptography</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Export of cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span>export of cryptography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and cryptographic software and hardware. Probably because of the importance of cryptanalysis in </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II">/wiki/World_War_II</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">World War II</a>"&gt;</span><span>World War II</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and an expectation that cryptography would continue to be important for national security, many Western governments have, at some point, strictly regulated export of cryptography. After World War II, it was illegal in the US to sell or distribute encryption technology overseas; in fact, encryption was designated as auxiliary military equipment and put on the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Munitions_List">/wiki/United_States_Munitions_List</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">United States Munitions List</a>"&gt;</span><span>United States Munitions List</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-cyberlaw_60-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-cyberlaw-60">#cite_note-cyberlaw-60</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>60<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Until the development of the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Personal_computer">/wiki/Personal_computer</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Personal computer</a>"&gt;</span><span>personal computer</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, asymmetric key algorithms (i.e., public key techniques), and the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet">/wiki/Internet</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Internet</a>"&gt;</span><span>Internet</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, this was not especially problematic. However, as the Internet grew and computers became more widely available, high-quality encryption techniques became well known around the globe.
<span id="line199"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line200"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-headline</a>" <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Export_controls</a>"&gt;</span><span>Export controls</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line201"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">role</span>="<a class="attribute-value">note</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">hatnote navigation-not-searchable</a>"&gt;</span><span>Main article: </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Export_of_cryptography">/wiki/Export_of_cryptography</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Export of cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span>Export of cryptography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line202"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>In the 1990s, there were several challenges to US export regulation of cryptography. After the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Source_code">/wiki/Source_code</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Source code</a>"&gt;</span><span>source code</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> for </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Philip_Zimmermann">/wiki/Philip_Zimmermann</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Philip Zimmermann</a>"&gt;</span><span>Philip Zimmermann</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>'s </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pretty_Good_Privacy">/wiki/Pretty_Good_Privacy</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Pretty Good Privacy</a>"&gt;</span><span>Pretty Good Privacy</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> (PGP) encryption program found its way onto the Internet in June 1991, a complaint by </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSA_Security">/wiki/RSA_Security</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">RSA Security</a>"&gt;</span><span>RSA Security</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> (then called RSA Data Security, Inc.) resulted in a lengthy criminal investigation of Zimmermann by the US Customs Service and the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Bureau_of_Investigation">/wiki/Federal_Bureau_of_Investigation</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Federal Bureau of Investigation</a>"&gt;</span><span>FBI</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, though no charges were ever filed.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-zim_61-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-zim-61">#cite_note-zim-61</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>61<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-levybook_62-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-levybook-62">#cite_note-levybook-62</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>62<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Daniel_J._Bernstein">/wiki/Daniel_J._Bernstein</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Daniel J. Bernstein</a>"&gt;</span><span>Daniel J. Bernstein</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, then a graduate student at </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UC_Berkeley">/wiki/UC_Berkeley</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">UC Berkeley</a>"&gt;</span><span>UC Berkeley</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, brought a lawsuit against the US government challenging some aspects of the restrictions based on </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/1st_Amendment">/wiki/1st_Amendment</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">1st Amendment</a>"&gt;</span><span>free speech</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> grounds. The 1995 case </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bernstein_v._United_States">/wiki/Bernstein_v._United_States</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Bernstein v. United States</a>"&gt;</span><span>Bernstein v. United States</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> ultimately resulted in a 1999 decision that printed source code for cryptographic algorithms and systems was protected as </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Freedom_of_speech">/wiki/Freedom_of_speech</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Freedom of speech</a>"&gt;</span><span>free speech</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> by the United States Constitution.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-b_v_us_63-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-b_v_us-63">#cite_note-b_v_us-63</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>63<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line203"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>In 1996, thirty-nine countries signed the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wassenaar_Arrangement">/wiki/Wassenaar_Arrangement</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Wassenaar Arrangement</a>"&gt;</span><span>Wassenaar Arrangement</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, an arms control treaty that deals with the export of arms and "dual-use" technologies such as cryptography. The treaty stipulated that the use of cryptography with short key-lengths (56-bit for symmetric encryption, 512-bit for RSA) would no longer be export-controlled.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-wa_64-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-wa-64">#cite_note-wa-64</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>64<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Cryptography exports from the US became less strictly regulated as a consequence of a major relaxation in 2000;</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-65</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-65">#cite_note-65</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>65<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> there are no longer very many restrictions on key sizes in US-</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Export_of_cryptography">/wiki/Export_of_cryptography</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Export of cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span>exported</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> mass-market software. Since this relaxation in US export restrictions, and because most personal computers connected to the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet">/wiki/Internet</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Internet</a>"&gt;</span><span>Internet</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> include US-sourced </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Web_browser">/wiki/Web_browser</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Web browser</a>"&gt;</span><span>web browsers</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> such as </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Firefox">/wiki/Firefox</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Firefox</a>"&gt;</span><span>Firefox</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> or </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_Explorer">/wiki/Internet_Explorer</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Internet Explorer</a>"&gt;</span><span>Internet Explorer</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, almost every Internet user worldwide has potential access to quality cryptography via their browsers (e.g., via </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Transport_Layer_Security">/wiki/Transport_Layer_Security</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Transport Layer Security</a>"&gt;</span><span>Transport Layer Security</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>). The </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mozilla_Thunderbird">/wiki/Mozilla_Thunderbird</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Mozilla Thunderbird</a>"&gt;</span><span>Mozilla Thunderbird</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Microsoft_Outlook">/wiki/Microsoft_Outlook</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Microsoft Outlook</a>"&gt;</span><span>Microsoft Outlook</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E-mail_client">/wiki/E-mail_client</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">E-mail client</a>"&gt;</span><span>E-mail client</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> programs similarly can transmit and receive emails via TLS, and can send and receive email encrypted with </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S/MIME">/wiki/S/MIME</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">S/MIME</a>"&gt;</span><span>S/MIME</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>. Many Internet users don't realize that their basic application software contains such extensive </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptosystem">/wiki/Cryptosystem</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Cryptosystem</a>"&gt;</span><span>cryptosystems</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>. These browsers and email programs are so ubiquitous that even governments whose intent is to regulate civilian use of cryptography generally don't find it practical to do much to control distribution or use of cryptography of this quality, so even when such laws are in force, actual enforcement is often effectively impossible.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">noprint Inline-Template Template-Fact</a>" <span class="attribute-name">style</span>="<a class="attribute-value">white-space:nowrap;</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed">/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Wikipedia:Citation needed</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">This claim needs references to reliable sources. (August 2013)</a>"&gt;</span><span>citation needed</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">i</span>&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line204"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line205"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-headline</a>" <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">NSA_involvement</a>"&gt;</span><span>NSA involvement</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line206"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumb tright</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">thumbinner</a>" <span <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">internal</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a
