headquarters in Fort Meade, Maryland</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line207"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">role</span>="<a class="attribute-value">note</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">hatnote navigation-not-searchable</a>"&gt;</span><span>See also: </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clipper_chip">/wiki/Clipper_chip</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Clipper chip</a>"&gt;</span><span>Clipper chip</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line208"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Another contentious issue connected to cryptography in the United States is the influence of the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Security_Agency">/wiki/National_Security_Agency</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">National Security Agency</a>"&gt;</span><span>National Security Agency</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> on cipher development and policy.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-RangerSteve1_8-3</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-RangerSteve1-8">#cite_note-RangerSteve1-8</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>8<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> The NSA was involved with the design of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_Encryption_Standard">/wiki/Data_Encryption_Standard</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Data Encryption Standard</a>"&gt;</span><span>DES</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> during its development at </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IBM">/wiki/IBM</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">IBM</a>"&gt;</span><span>IBM</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and its consideration by the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/National_Bureau_of_Standards">/wiki/National_Bureau_of_Standards</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">National Bureau of Standards</a>"&gt;</span><span>National Bureau of Standards</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> as a possible Federal Standard for cryptography.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-cryptogram_66-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-cryptogram-66">#cite_note-cryptogram-66</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>66<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> DES was designed to be resistant to </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Differential_cryptanalysis">/wiki/Differential_cryptanalysis</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Differential cryptanalysis</a>"&gt;</span><span>differential cryptanalysis</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>,</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-coppersmith-des_67-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-coppersmith-des-67">#cite_note-coppersmith-des-67</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>67<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> a powerful and general cryptanalytic technique known to the NSA and IBM, that became publicly known only when it was rediscovered in the late 1980s.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-68</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-68">#cite_note-68</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>68<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> According to </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steven_Levy">/wiki/Steven_Levy</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Steven Levy</a>"&gt;</span><span>Steven Levy</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, IBM discovered differential cryptanalysis,</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-levybook_62-1</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-levybook-62">#cite_note-levybook-62</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>62<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> but kept the technique secret at the NSA's request. The technique became publicly known only when Biham and Shamir re-discovered and announced it some years later. The entire affair illustrates the difficulty of determining what resources and knowledge an attacker might actually have.
<span id="line209"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Another instance of the NSA's involvement was the 1993 </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clipper_chip">/wiki/Clipper_chip</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Clipper chip</a>"&gt;</span><span>Clipper chip</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> affair, an encryption microchip intended to be part of the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Capstone_(cryptography)">/wiki/Capstone_(cryptography)</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Capstone (cryptography)</a>"&gt;</span><span>Capstone</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> cryptography-control initiative. Clipper was widely criticized by cryptographers for two reasons. The cipher algorithm (called </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Skipjack_(cipher)">/wiki/Skipjack_(cipher)</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Skipjack (cipher)</a>"&gt;</span><span>Skipjack</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>) was then classified (declassified in 1998, long after the Clipper initiative lapsed). The classified cipher caused concerns that the NSA had deliberately made the cipher weak in order to assist its intelligence efforts. The whole initiative was also criticized based on its violation of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerckhoffs%27s_Principle">/wiki/Kerckhoffs%27s_Principle</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Kerckhoffs<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#39;</span>s Principle</a>"&gt;</span><span>Kerckhoffs's Principle</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, as the scheme included a special </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Key_escrow">/wiki/Key_escrow</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Key escrow</a>"&gt;</span><span>escrow key</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> held by the government for use by law enforcement (i.e. </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telephone_tapping">/wiki/Telephone_tapping</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Telephone tapping</a>"&gt;</span><span>wiretapping</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>).</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-levybook_62-2</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-levybook-62">#cite_note-levybook-62</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>62<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line210"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line211"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-headline</a>" <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Digital_rights_management</a>"&gt;</span><span>Digital rights management</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line212"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">role</span>="<a class="attribute-value">note</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">hatnote navigation-not-searchable</a>"&gt;</span><span>Main article: </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_rights_management">/wiki/Digital_rights_management</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Digital rights management</a>"&gt;</span><span>Digital rights management</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line213"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>Cryptography is central to digital rights management (DRM), a group of techniques for technologically controlling use of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Copyright">/wiki/Copyright</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Copyright</a>"&gt;</span><span>copyrighted</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> material, being widely implemented and deployed at the behest of some copyright holders. In 1998, </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._President">/wiki/U.S._President</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">U.S. President</a>"&gt;</span><span>U.S. President</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bill_Clinton">/wiki/Bill_Clinton</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Bill Clinton</a>"&gt;</span><span>Bill Clinton</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> signed the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_Millennium_Copyright_Act">/wiki/Digital_Millennium_Copyright_Act</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Digital Millennium Copyright Act</a>"&gt;</span><span>Digital Millennium Copyright Act</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> (DMCA), which criminalized all production, dissemination, and use of certain cryptanalytic techniques and technology (now known or later discovered); specifically, those that could be used to circumvent DRM technological schemes.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-DMCA_69-0</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-DMCA-69">#cite_note-DMCA-69</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>69<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> This had a noticeable impact on the cryptography research community since an argument can be made that any cryptanalytic research violated the DMCA. Similar statutes have since been enacted in several countries and regions, including the implementation in the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Directive_on_the_harmonisation_of_certain_aspects_of_copyright_and_related_rights_in_the_information_society">/wiki/Directive_on_the_harmonisation_of_certain_aspects_of_copyright_and_related_rights_in_the_information_society</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Directive on the harmonisation of certain aspects of copyright and related rights in the information society</a>"&gt;</span><span>EU Copyright Directive</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>. Similar restrictions are called for by treaties signed by </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Intellectual_Property_Organization">/wiki/World_Intellectual_Property_Organization</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">World Intellectual Property Organization</a>"&gt;</span><span>World Intellectual Property Organization</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> member-states.
<span id="line214"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>The </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Justice">/wiki/United_States_Department_of_Justice</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">United States Department of Justice</a>"&gt;</span><span>United States Department of Justice</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Bureau_of_Investigation">/wiki/Federal_Bureau_of_Investigation</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Federal Bureau of Investigation</a>"&gt;</span><span>FBI</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> have not enforced the DMCA as rigorously as had been feared by some, but the law, nonetheless, remains a controversial one. </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Niels_Ferguson">/wiki/Niels_Ferguson</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Niels Ferguson</a>"&gt;</span><span>Niels Ferguson</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, a well-respected cryptography researcher, has publicly stated that he will not release some of his research into an </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Intel_Corporation">/wiki/Intel_Corporation</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Intel Corporation</a>"&gt;</span><span>Intel</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> security design for fear of prosecution under the DMCA.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-70</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-70">#cite_note-70</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>70<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Cryptologist </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruce_Schneier">/wiki/Bruce_Schneier</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Bruce Schneier</a>"&gt;</span><span>Bruce Schneier</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> has argued that the DMCA encourages </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vendor_lock-in">/wiki/Vendor_lock-in</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Vendor lock-in</a>"&gt;</span><span>vendor lock-in</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, while inhibiting actual measures toward cyber-security.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-71</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-71">#cite_note-71</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>71<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Both </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alan_Cox">/wiki/Alan_Cox</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Alan Cox</a>"&gt;</span><span>Alan Cox</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> (longtime </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Linux_kernel">/wiki/Linux_kernel</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Linux kernel</a>"&gt;</span><span>Linux kernel</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> developer) and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edward_Felten">/wiki/Edward_Felten</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Edward Felten</a>"&gt;</span><span>Edward Felten</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> (and some of his students at Princeton) have encountered problems related to the Act. </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dmitry_Sklyarov">/wiki/Dmitry_Sklyarov</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Dmitry Sklyarov</a>"&gt;</span><span>Dmitry Sklyarov</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> was arrested during a visit to the US from Russia, and jailed for five months pending trial for alleged violations of the DMCA arising from work he had done in Russia, where the work was legal. In 2007, the cryptographic keys responsible for </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blu-ray">/wiki/Blu-ray</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Blu-ray</a>"&gt;</span><span>Blu-ray</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/HD_DVD">/wiki/HD_DVD</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">HD DVD</a>"&gt;</span><span>HD DVD</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> content scrambling were </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AACS_encryption_key_controversy">/wiki/AACS_encryption_key_controversy</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">AACS encryption key controversy</a>"&gt;</span><span>discovered and released onto the Internet</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>. In both cases, the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MPAA">/wiki/MPAA</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">MPAA</a>"&gt;</span><span>Motion Picture Association of America</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> sent out numerous DMCA takedown notices, and there was a massive Internet backlash</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-AACS_9-1</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-AACS-9">#cite_note-AACS-9</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>9<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> triggered by the perceived impact of such notices on </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fair_use">/wiki/Fair_use</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Fair use</a>"&gt;</span><span>fair use</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> and </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Free_speech">/wiki/Free_speech</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-redirect</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Free speech</a>"&gt;</span><span>free speech</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>.
<span id="line215"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line216"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-headline</a>" <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Forced_disclosure_of_encryption_keys</a>"&gt;</span><span>Forced disclosure of encryption keys</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">h3</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line217"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">div</span> <span class="attribute-name">role</span>="<a class="attribute-value">note</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">hatnote navigation-not-searchable</a>"&gt;</span><span>Main article: </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Key_disclosure_law">/wiki/Key_disclosure_law</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Key disclosure law</a>"&gt;</span><span>Key disclosure law</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">div</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line218"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>In the United Kingdom, the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regulation_of_Investigatory_Powers_Act_2000">/wiki/Regulation_of_Investigatory_Powers_Act_2000</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act 2000</a>"&gt;</span><span>Regulation of Investigatory Powers Act</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> gives UK police the powers to force suspects to decrypt files or hand over passwords that protect encryption keys. Failure to comply is an offense in its own right, punishable on conviction by a two-year jail sentence or up to five years in cases involving national security.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-UK_law_7-1</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-UK_law-7">#cite_note-UK_law-7</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>7<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Successful prosecutions have occurred under the Act; the first, in 2009,</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-72</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-72">#cite_note-72</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>72<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> resulted in a term of 13 months' imprisonment.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-73</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-73">#cite_note-73</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>73<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> Similar forced disclosure laws in Australia, Finland, France, and India compel individual suspects under investigation to hand over encryption keys or passwords during a criminal investigation.
<span id="line219"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>In the United States, the federal criminal case of </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_v._Fricosu">/wiki/United_States_v._Fricosu</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">United States v. Fricosu</a>"&gt;</span><span>United States v. Fricosu</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> addressed whether a search warrant can compel a person to reveal an </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Encryption">/wiki/Encryption</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Encryption</a>"&gt;</span><span>encryption</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Passphrase">/wiki/Passphrase</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Passphrase</a>"&gt;</span><span>passphrase</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> or password.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-74</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-74">#cite_note-74</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>74<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> The </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Electronic_Frontier_Foundation">/wiki/Electronic_Frontier_Foundation</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Electronic Frontier Foundation</a>"&gt;</span><span>Electronic Frontier Foundation</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> (EFF) argued that this is a violation of the protection from self-incrimination given by the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fifth_Amendment_to_the_United_States_Constitution">/wiki/Fifth_Amendment_to_the_United_States_Constitution</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution</a>"&gt;</span><span>Fifth Amendment</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-75</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-75">#cite_note-75</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>75<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span> In 2012, the court ruled that under the </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/All_Writs_Act">/wiki/All_Writs_Act</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">All Writs Act</a>"&gt;</span><span>All Writs Act</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, the defendant was required to produce an unencrypted hard drive for the court.</span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">sup</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_ref-76</a>" <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_note-76">#cite_note-76</a>"&gt;</span><span><span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#91;</span>76<span class="entity"><span>&amp;</span>#93;</span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">sup</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line220"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>In many jurisdictions, the legal status of forced disclosure remains unclear.
<span id="line221"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>The 2016 </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FBI%E2%80%93Apple_encryption_dispute">/wiki/FBI%E2%80%93Apple_encryption_dispute</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">FBI–Apple encryption dispute</a>"&gt;</span><span>FBI–Apple encryption dispute</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> concerns the ability of courts in the United States to compel manufacturers' assistance in unlocking cell phones whose contents are cryptographically protected.
<span id="line222"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>As a potential counter-measure to forced disclosure some cryptographic software supports </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plausible_deniability">/wiki/Plausible_deniability</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Plausible deniability</a>"&gt;</span><span>plausible deniability</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>, where the encrypted data is indistinguishable from unused random data (for example such as that of a </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_remanence">/wiki/Data_remanence</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Data remanence</a>"&gt;</span><span>drive which has been securely wiped</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>).
<span id="line223"></span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">p</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line224"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">h2</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-headline</a>" <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">See_also</a>"&gt;</span><span>See also</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">h2</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line225"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">ul</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Outline_of_cryptography">/wiki/Outline_of_cryptography</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Outline of cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span>Outline of cryptography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line226"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">ul</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptographers">/wiki/List_of_cryptographers</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">List of cryptographers</a>"&gt;</span><span>List of cryptographers</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line227"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_important_publications_in_cryptography">/wiki/List_of_important_publications_in_cryptography</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">List of important publications in cryptography</a>"&gt;</span><span>List of important publications in cryptography</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line228"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_multiple_discoveries#20th_century">/wiki/List_of_multiple_discoveries#20th_century</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">List of multiple discoveries</a>"&gt;</span><span>List of multiple discoveries</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span>
<span id="line229"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_unsolved_problems_in_computer_science">/wiki/List_of_unsolved_problems_in_computer_science</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">List of unsolved problems in computer science</a>"&gt;</span><span>List of unsolved problems in computer science</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span>

<span id="line327"></span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">li</span> <span class="attribute-name">id</span>="<a class="attribute-value">cite_note-43</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">mw-cite-backlink</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">b</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cryptography#cite_ref-43">#cite_ref-43</a>"&gt;</span><span>^</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">b</span>&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span> </span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">span</span> <span class="attribute-name">class</span>="<a class="attribute-value">reference-text</a>"&gt;</span><span></span><span>&lt;<span class="start-tag">a</span> <span class="attribute-name">href</span>="<a class="attribute-value" href="view-source:https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ralph_Merkle">/wiki/Ralph_Merkle</a>" <span class="attribute-name">title</span>="<a class="attribute-value">Ralph Merkle</a>"&gt;</span><span>Ralph Merkle</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">a</span>&gt;</span><span> was working on similar ideas at the time and encountered publication delays, and Hellman has suggested that the term used should be Diffie–Hellman–Merkle aysmmetric key cryptography.</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">span</span>&gt;</span><span>

href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r935243608">mw-data:TemplateStyles:r935243608</a>"<span>/</span>&gt;</span><span>, giving an overview of international law issues regarding cryptography.</span><span>&lt;/<span class="end-tag">li</span>&gt;</span><span>
